results.title: Future
results.creator_credit: Pat Hunder, Garry Dunstan and It's About Time
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “Not suitable for adults”.
Is there life after puberty? This program examines through a series of comic sketches and original songs, the fears and expectations of teenagers as they anticipate leaving school. The future is seen not only as a time of adventure, but uncertainty, where key decisions must be made. School, life at work and the responsibilities of being an adult are highlighted.

results.title: Future
results.brief_description: Approaches the possibilities for life in the future through three distinct scenarios a world reached through technological developments, a world of economic, social and ecological collapse, and a world where the possibility of solving our problems and surviving becomes apparent

results.title: Fuse
results.creator_credit: Katherine Shortland, Marcus Waters, Maia Horniak and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
A young Aboriginal girl wants to revenge the death of her older brother who has died while in jail for a petty crime. He was the only person she had in the world and now, desperately alone and angry, she finds the judge that sentenced her brother.
The film unfolds in the judge’s bachelor apartment where he is tied up and held captive as each of them confront their own judgements and their own pain.
An intense drama between two completely different people in one room over one night unfolds as they both behave in unexpected ways. Human emotions cross between the race, sex and class divide as each rediscover the meaning of loneliness, loss and judgement.
Cast: Shai Pittman, Chris Haywood
results.creator_credit_for_label: Katherine Shortland, Marcus Waters, Maia Horniak and AFTRS

results.title: Further skills
results.creator_credit: Don Kelly and Gerard Holdsworth Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Judo”.
The object of the fourth film is to “sound off” the basic skills of judo. In this demonstration harai-goshi and uchi-mata are contrasted and tsurikomi-goshi - a blocking type of throw, some immobilisations, throws, and ankle-trips are illustrated.

results.title: Further extensions to the skill range
results.creator_credit: Don Kelly and Gerard Holdsworth Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Judo”.
The object of the third film in this series is to show how the range can be enlarged still further while keeping to the same pattern of learning as the first two films. Training exercises, a strangle shown from the back of the opponent, more throws - Kouchi and Kosoto-gake, an introduction to sutemi-waza, and some free play are shown. Photographed by Don Kelly.

results.title: Furniture Craftsman
results.creator_credit: Edwin James Hipkiss and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: The work of designers and craftsmen in manufacturing “custom built” furniture. Pattern-making, laying out, band-sawing, power planing, joining, lathe turning, grooving, glueing, carving and finishing, as well as the relation between hand-tool operations and machine-tool operations are dealt with in detail.
